notes.name: Note 1: Introduction
notes.body:
iNotebook
===
> This is an iNotebook for interactive computing.

### Overview

iNotebooks provide an interactive environment for computation, data analysis, and data visualization. The basic unit of an iNotebook is a __note__.

A note can serve a variety of purposes:

*	__documentation__: placing concepts and computation within context. Documentation can be external facing (formal how-to guides, tutorials, reports, and manuals) or a simple means to jot down your thoughts and questions.
*	__computation__: performing analysis and applying algorithms to data.
*	__visualization__: encoding computational output in visually compelling and informative ways.

### Getting Started

Notes come in different flavors (*modes*): __Markdown__ and __JavaScript__. All notes, regardless of mode, are executed using `Ctrl-Enter` (PC) or `Cmd-Enter` (Mac).

#### Markdown

Markdown notes (such as this note) support standard Markdown formatting. Code snippets are syntax highlighted.

``` javascript
function beep( a, b ) {
	return a+b;
}
```

#### JavaScript

iNotebooks use JavaScript as their core computation language. All notes within a notebook share a common variable workspace. Hence, variables declared in one note can be referenced, modified, and rendered in other notes within the same notebook.
